Her comments were in response to a question posed to Miss California Carrie Prejean in the April 19 Miss USA Pageant. Homosexual celeblogger Perez Hilton was the pageant judge who asked Prejean her opinion of same-sex marriage, to which she responded that marriage should be between a man and a woman. Outraged by her response, Hilton began blasting the beauty queen and asked for celebrities to share their thoughts on gay marriage. Miley Cyrus responded to Hilton through her Twitter.com account with the following comments: • "Everyone deserves to love and be loved and most importantly smile." • "Jesus loves you and your partner and wants you to know how much he cares! That's like a daddy not loving his lil boy cuz he's gay and that is wrong and very sad! • "Like I said everyone deserves to be happy." • "God’s greatest commandment is to love. And judging is not loving." • "I am a Christian and I love you - gay or not - because you are no different than anyone else! We are all God's children." Such statements will send the wrong message to our children who are influenced by this teenage megastar. Parents need to realize that Cyrus is not the positive role model she was once thought to be. Take action Send Miley Cyrus a letter stating that you do not approve of her comments. Clearly she is confused and does not understand the Bible. Please pray for the Lord to open her eyes to the truth. title: Does God condemn tolerant people?

content: The very word "judgement" has taken on the aura of evil in the world, or at least our part of it today. In the modern world here, everybody is afraid of being held to account over the last forty years there has been a concerted effort to remove the stigma from deviance and the genuine evil of many acts. By defining all of them down to a level to where they are tolerated in one degree or other, instead of being rightfully condemned as WRONG!! By this statement, I do NOT mean homosexuality in general. But! The North American Man Boy Love Association, I believe, rightfully earns our condemnation!! Like wise the exploitation of children in any form. Like wise the wrongful treatment of women. The wrongful treatment of minorities. Murder, somehow, seems to get an excuse......theft....the same.....violent behaviour...the same..............all kinds of things that are clearly wrong, seem to have excuses made for them daily....WHY??? Because each of us can see ourselves under certain circumstances making mistakes that could land us in the same, or worse trouble...don't we?? I have seen the documents that have asserted that this is a deliberate course of action to turn us against our selves, just the same way I have seen documents that plan to use our "tolerance" and the wedge issues that it raises in everyday commerce, against us in the "west" vs the "muslim problem" our very laws of tolerance are now being used to drive wedges between us, by Islamic operatives in seeking "balance" which is not balance at all!! But, are concerted efforts to gain a subliminal advantage over our western culture to defeat us by our own largess. No this does not belong under the "conspiracy thread" title and before somebody accuses me of it, I am forswearing any anti Islamic bias which most here know, is B.S. to accuse me of from the git go, but there are new people around who don't know my track record on, "acceptance issues". This is the danger of being afraid to call anything wrong!! And now, is being used against us with a vengeance in this area, as it has in the area of political things and criminal justice to drive those wedges ever deeper between us. We, all of us, need to be aware that this is planned by some to the detriment of the many. A society that loses it's surity of purpose is a lost society. It is precisely because we are an "open society" that we face this particular danger...why?? Well, think about it, you have read this and are immediately prepared to call me a crackpot and dismiss everything I have written here aren't you........I rest my case. T

T First off, Bruce, I don't consider you a "crackpot". I may (and often do) disagree with you on purely political matters, but I am willing to "tolerate" your views. But that's the point here, I believe. When is tolerance acceptable? When is intolerance acceptable? If it is acceptable to be intolerant of another's views on same sex civil unions (based on your personal religious beliefs), is it also acceptable for a Roman Catholic to be intolerant of a Protestant (based on the Catholic's religious beliefs, articulated by the present Pope's pronouncement that only Roman Catholics are true Christians and all other Christian denominations are flawed) and is it acceptable for the Roman Catholic to write laws to make it a criminal offense to attend an Protestant religious service? I don't smoke tobacco - but I tolerate those who do and question those who feel that smoking tobacco should be criminalized in order to protect smokers from themselves. Does that make me a "bad" person because I am not intolerant of tobacco smokers? I am very much a libertarian on social issues - live and let live as long as your actions don't harm others and if you did something wrong in this life, God will judge you and deal with you accordingly. I guess in the eyes of the American Family Association that means I am an agent of Satan, doing my best to destroy the United States.

"http://faq.afa.net/index.php?option=com_content&task=view&id=337&Itemid=35" quote: Miley Cyrus said what? "Hannah Montana" star Miley Cyrus recently made statements supporting gay marriage. Her comments were in response to a question posed to Miss California Carrie Prejean in the April 19 Miss USA Pageant. Homosexual celeblogger Perez Hilton was the pageant judge who asked Prejean her opinion of same-sex marriage, to which she responded that marriage should be between a man and a woman. Outraged by her response, Hilton began blasting the beauty queen and asked for celebrities to share their thoughts on gay marriage. Miley Cyrus responded to Hilton through her Twitter.com account with the following comments: • "Everyone deserves to love and be loved and most importantly smile." • "Jesus loves you and your partner and wants you to know how much he cares! That's like a daddy not loving his lil boy cuz he's gay and that is wrong and very sad! • "Like I said everyone deserves to be happy." • "God’s greatest commandment is to love. And judging is not loving." • "I am a Christian and I love you - gay or not - because you are no different than anyone else! We are all God's children." Such statements will send the wrong message to our children who are influenced by this teenage megastar. Parents need to realize that Cyrus is not the positive role model she was once thought to be. Take action Send Miley Cyrus a letter stating that you do not approve of her comments. Clearly she is confused and does not understand the Bible. Please pray for the Lord to open her eyes to the truth. content: The very word "judgement" has taken on the aura of evil in the world, or at least our part of it today. In the modern world here, everybody is afraid of being held to account over the last forty years there has been a concerted effort to remove the stigma from deviance and the genuine evil of many acts. By defining all of them down to a level to where they are tolerated in one degree or other, instead of being rightfully condemned as WRONG!! By this statement, I do NOT mean homosexuality in general. But! The North American Man Boy Love Association, I believe, rightfully earns our condemnation!! Like wise the exploitation of children in any form. Like wise the wrongful treatment of women. The wrongful treatment of minorities. Murder, somehow, seems to get an excuse......theft....the same.....violent behaviour...the same..............all kinds of things that are clearly wrong, seem to have excuses made for them daily....WHY??? Because each of us can see ourselves under certain circumstances making mistakes that could land us in the same, or worse trouble...don't we?? I have seen the documents that have asserted that this is a deliberate course of action to turn us against our selves, just the same way I have seen documents that plan to use our "tolerance" and the wedge issues that it raises in everyday commerce, against us in the "west" vs the "muslim problem" our very laws of tolerance are now being used to drive wedges between us, by Islamic operatives in seeking "balance" which is not balance at all!! But, are concerted efforts to gain a subliminal advantage over our western culture to defeat us by our own largess. No this does not belong under the "conspiracy thread" title and before somebody accuses me of it, I am forswearing any anti Islamic bias which most here know, is B.S. to accuse me of from the git go, but there are new people around who don't know my track record on, "acceptance issues". This is the danger of being afraid to call anything wrong!! And now, is being used against us with a vengeance in this area, as it has in the area of political things and criminal justice to drive those wedges ever deeper between us. We, all of us, need to be aware that this is planned by some to the detriment of the many. A society that loses it's surity of purpose is a lost society. It is precisely because we are an "open society" that we face this particular danger...why?? Well, think about it, you have read this and are immediately prepared to call me a crackpot and dismiss everything I have written here aren't you........I rest my case. T

T First off, Bruce, I don't consider you a "crackpot". I may (and often do) disagree with you on purely political matters, but I am willing to "tolerate" your views. But that's the point here, I believe. When is tolerance acceptable? When is intolerance acceptable? If it is acceptable to be intolerant of another's views on same sex civil unions (based on your personal religious beliefs), is it also acceptable for a Roman Catholic to be intolerant of a Protestant (based on the Catholic's religious beliefs, articulated by the present Pope's pronouncement that only Roman Catholics are true Christians and all other Christian denominations are flawed) and is it acceptable for the Roman Catholic to write laws to make it a criminal offense to attend an Protestant religious service? I don't smoke tobacco - but I tolerate those who do and question those who feel that smoking tobacco should be criminalized in order to protect smokers from themselves. Does that make me a "bad" person because I am not intolerant of tobacco smokers? I am very much a libertarian on social issues - live and let live as long as your actions don't harm others and if you did something wrong in this life, God will judge you and deal with you accordingly. I guess in the eyes of the American Family Association that means I am an agent of Satan, doing my best to destroy the United States.

Homosexual celeblogger Perez Hilton was the pageant judge who asked Prejean her opinion of same-sex marriage, to which she responded that marriage should be between a man and a woman. And judging is not loving." • "I am a Christian and I love you - gay or not - because you are no different than anyone else! We are all God's children." content: The very word "judgement" has taken on the aura of evil in the world, or at least our part of it today. In the modern world here, everybody is afraid of being held to account over the last forty years there has been a concerted effort to remove the stigma from deviance and the genuine evil of many acts. By defining all of them down to a level to where they are tolerated in one degree or other, instead of being rightfully condemned as WRONG!! By this statement, I do NOT mean homosexuality in general. But! The North American Man Boy Love Association, I believe, rightfully earns our condemnation!! Like wise the exploitation of children in any form. Like wise the wrongful treatment of women. The wrongful treatment of minorities. Murder, somehow, seems to get an excuse......theft....the same.....violent behaviour...the same..............all kinds of things that are clearly wrong, seem to have excuses made for them daily....WHY??? Because each of us can see ourselves under certain circumstances making mistakes that could land us in the same, or worse trouble...don't we?? I have seen the documents that have asserted that this is a deliberate course of action to turn us against our selves, just the same way I have seen documents that plan to use our "tolerance" and the wedge issues that it raises in everyday commerce, against us in the "west" vs the "muslim problem" our very laws of tolerance are now being used to drive wedges between us, by Islamic operatives in seeking "balance" which is not balance at all!! But, are concerted efforts to gain a subliminal advantage over our western culture to defeat us by our own largess. No this does not belong under the "conspiracy thread" title and before somebody accuses me of it, I am forswearing any anti Islamic bias which most here know, is B.S. to accuse me of from the git go, but there are new people around who don't know my track record on, "acceptance issues". This is the danger of being afraid to call anything wrong!! And now, is being used against us with a vengeance in this area, as it has in the area of political things and criminal justice to drive those wedges ever deeper between us. We, all of us, need to be aware that this is planned by some to the detriment of the many. A society that loses it's surity of purpose is a lost society. It is precisely because we are an "open society" that we face this particular danger...why?? Well, think about it, you have read this and are immediately prepared to call me a crackpot and dismiss everything I have written here aren't you........I rest my case. T

T First off, Bruce, I don't consider you a "crackpot". I may (and often do) disagree with you on purely political matters, but I am willing to "tolerate" your views. But that's the point here, I believe. When is tolerance acceptable? When is intolerance acceptable? If it is acceptable to be intolerant of another's views on same sex civil unions (based on your personal religious beliefs), is it also acceptable for a Roman Catholic to be intolerant of a Protestant (based on the Catholic's religious beliefs, articulated by the present Pope's pronouncement that only Roman Catholics are true Christians and all other Christian denominations are flawed) and is it acceptable for the Roman Catholic to write laws to make it a criminal offense to attend an Protestant religious service? I don't smoke tobacco - but I tolerate those who do and question those who feel that smoking tobacco should be criminalized in order to protect smokers from themselves. Does that make me a "bad" person because I am not intolerant of tobacco smokers? I am very much a libertarian on social issues - live and let live as long as your actions don't harm others and if you did something wrong in this life, God will judge you and deal with you accordingly. I guess in the eyes of the American Family Association that means I am an agent of Satan, doing my best to destroy the United States.

title: Does God condemn tolerant people?

content: quote: Originally posted by greywolfghost: Does God tolerate sin or evil? He watches and waits and then judges at the Final Judgment. He does not appoint special, select humans to use the civil and criminal laws to punish those who special, select humans have decided have sinned or were evil. Does God rationalize? No. People do. If they believe something strongly, based on their own emotions and prejudices - like, "God hates gay people" - they then rationalize that the little voice in their head is God agreeing with them on their prejudices. Does God change from day to day after testing which way the wind is blowing? No. People do. The bigger the crowd and the louder the crowd roars, the more likely a person will "test the way the wind is blowing" and will go along with the crowd. That's why good Christian men and women join lynch mobs - and then later rationalize that by lynching someone, they were "doing God's work".

content: quote: Does God tolerate sin or evil? Since God controls all including the consequence that evil had on our lives, He uses evil (satan) to teach us what is in our own hearts. it is a beautiful system.
